hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday drop on high negative sentiment news (e.g., ETF outflows, macro catalyst), followed by a 4-hour compression period (Bollinger Band Width < 0.5), the subsequent breakout in the direction of the initial drop will extend by an additional 3-5% within 12 hours as delayed reactions and stop-loss cascades amplify the move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp negative moves on concrete news often trigger an initial wave of selling, followed by a consolidation as weak hands exit. The compression represents a temporary equilibrium before a second wave of selling from momentum traders and triggered stops amplifies the original catalyst. The 4-hour filter ensures the move isn't immediately reversed.
entry_conditions: BTC 4hr close shows >5% drop from previous close
News sentiment score (proprietary or alternative) < 0.3 (highly negative) on drop day
Following 4 consecutive 4hr candles have Bollinger Band (20,2) Width < 0.5 (compression)
Price breaks below the low of the compression range by >0.5%

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close back above the compression range high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such signals result in a false breakout (reversal above compression high) or fail to reach the 3% extension target within the time window.
